Articles.Content:
I guess this is kind of a copy of the thread I have in the space lounge, but I'm making this second one mostly for the announcement of KSP streams (I think I may just use this page for all my stream announcements from now on, and ask for the old thread to be locked.

I now have an image link instead which should tell you when I am streaming. This should make things easier.

[![Noname117Spore.png](http://streambadge.com/twitch/dark/Noname117Spore.png)](http://twitch.tv/Noname117Spore)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-18T21:36:24Z" title="08/18/2015 09:36  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 18, 2015</time> by Noname117**

Stream ended, but I kind of need to post this announcement. For the next stream I do (Likely tomorrow) I will need someone with good knowledge of KSP's aerodynamics system. The new Banshee variant is suffering from "overyaw," and I want to know if I am using too large of a control surface for yaw or if there is an inherent design flaw causing the issue.
Starting up a new stream to continue to modify some of my NAFA aircraft up to the latest version, if anyone wants to join.
I think it is time to do a nice photoshoot for my new aircraft. I hope to see you there!
Time for another stream today. I think I'm going to get my first (in a long time) warship built for the naval battle club. The stream will be starting in a few minutes. Keep an eye on the link.

Been doing a long stream today, with the intention of circumnavigating Kerbin with only one of my 2 basic jet engines functioning while staying below 1 km. The low flying can be a bit nerve-racking sometimes. Please come check it out!
I should probably tell you that I'm doing another stream for Project Phoenix right now. Going to be building a Space Shuttle, launched dreamchaser style though.
